manify.embedders.vae

Product space variational autoencoder implementation

Classes

ProductSpaceVAE(encoder, decoder, pm[, ...])

Variational Autoencoder (VAE) for data in a mixed-curvature product manifold space.
class manify.embedders.vae.ProductSpaceVAE(encoder, decoder, pm, beta=1.0, reconstruction_loss='mse', device='cpu', n_samples=16)

Bases: Module

Variational Autoencoder (VAE) for data in a mixed-curvature product manifold space. This VAE model leverages a product manifold structure for latent representations, enabling flexible encodings in spaces with different curvature properties (e.g., hyperbolic, Euclidean, spherical).

decode(z)

Decoding in product space VAE

Return type:

Float[Tensor, 'batch_size n_features']

elbo(x)

Computes the Evidence Lower Bound (ELBO).

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) – Input data of shape (batch_size, n_features).

Returns:

Mean ELBO, mean log-likelihood, and mean KL divergence across the batch.

Return type:

tuple

encode(x)

Must return z_mean, z_logvar

Return type:

Tuple[Float[Tensor, 'batch_size n_latent'], Float[Tensor, 'batch_size n_latent']]

forward(x)

Performs the forward pass of the VAE.

Encodes the input, samples latent variables, and decodes to reconstruct the input.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) – Input data of shape (batch_size, n_features).

Returns:

Reconstructed data, latent means, and latent variances.

Return type:

tuple

kl_divergence(z_mean, sigma_factorized)

Computes the KL divergence between posterior and prior distributions.

Parameters:

  • z_mean (torch.Tensor) – Latent means of shape (batch_size, n_latent).

  • sigma_factorized (list of torch.Tensor) – Factorized covariance matrices for each latent dimension.

Returns:

KL divergence values for each data point in the batch.

Return type:

torch.Tensor
